abstract: Energy Transfer raised its offer for Southern Union to $44.25 a share, slightly edging past the Williams Companies’ most recent $44 a share bid.
snippet: Energy Transfer raised its offer for Southern Union to $44.25 a share, slightly edging past the Williams Companies’ most recent $44 a share bid.
lead_paragraph: Locked in a bidding war for the Southern Union Company, Energy Transfer Equity said Tuesday that it would raise its bid for the pipeline operator to $5.9 billion, edging past a rival offer by the Williams Companies.

headline.main: Energy Transfer Bumps Its Southern Union Bid

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
